title: Noun modification
explanation: Modifiers always come before the word they modify. Nouns can be modified by words or sentences.

examples.japanese: ミラーさんのうち
examples.english: Mr. Miller's house

examples.japanese: 新しいうち
examples.english: a new house

examples.japanese: きれいなうち
examples.english: a beautiful house

title: Noun modification by sentences
explanation: Sentences in the plain form can modify nouns. な-adjective sentences change 〜だ to 〜な, and noun sentences change 〜だ to 〜の.

examples.japanese: 京都へ行く人
examples.english: a person who goes to Kyoto

examples.japanese: 京都へ行かない人
examples.english: a person who does not go to Kyoto

examples.japanese: 京都へ行った人
examples.english: a person who went to Kyoto

examples.japanese: 京都へ行かなかった人
examples.english: a person who did not go to Kyoto

examples.japanese: 背が高くて、髪が黒い人
examples.english: a person who is tall and has black hair

examples.japanese: 親切できれいな人
examples.english: a person who is kind and pretty

examples.japanese: 65歳の人
examples.english: a person who is 65 years old

examples.japanese: わたしが先週見た映画
examples.english: the movie that I saw last week

examples.japanese: ワンさんが働いている病院
examples.english: the hospital where Mr. Wang works

examples.japanese: わたしがあした会う友達
examples.english: the friend whom I will meet tomorrow

examples.japanese: これはミラーさんが住んでいたうちです。
examples.english: This is the house where Mr. Miller lived.

examples.japanese: ミラーさんが住んでいたうちは古いです。
examples.english: The house where Mr. Miller lived is old.

examples.japanese: ミラーさんが住んでいたうちを買いました。
examples.english: I bought the house where Mr. Miller lived.

examples.japanese: わたしはミラーさんが住んでいたうちが好きです。
examples.english: I like the house where Mr. Miller lived.

examples.japanese: ミラーさんが住んでいたうちに猫がいました。
examples.english: There was a cat in the house where Mr. Miller lived.

examples.japanese: ミラーさんが住んでいたうちへ行ったことがあります。
examples.english: I have been to the house where Mr. Miller lived.

title: Nが
explanation: When a sentence modifies a noun, the subject in the sentence is marked by が instead of は.

examples.japanese: これはミラーさんが作ったケーキです。
examples.english: This is the cake which Mr. Miller baked.

examples.japanese: わたしはカリナさんがかいた絵が好きです。
examples.english: I like the picture that Ms. Karina drew.

examples.japanese: 彼が生まれた所を知っていますか。
examples.english: Do you know the place where he was born?

title: V dictionary form + 時間/約束/用事
explanation: The dictionary form of a verb can be placed before 時間, 約束, or 用事 to indicate the content of the time, appointment, or business.

examples.japanese: わたしは朝ごはんを食べる時間がありません。
examples.english: I have no time to eat breakfast.

examples.japanese: わたしは友達と映画を見る約束があります。
examples.english: I have an arrangement to see a movie with a friend of mine.

examples.japanese: きょうは市役所へ行く用事があります。
examples.english: I have something to do at the city hall today.
